question_title: Will the interest in “hospital” change between 2026-02-03 and 2026-02-15 according to Google Trends?
summary: The "hospital" search term is stable with documented weekly periodicity (weekday > weekend). Comparing Tuesday (Feb 3) to Sunday (Feb 15) creates a slight bias toward decreases. The severe flu season is past peak and stabilizing, reducing spike probability. The ±3 threshold is narrow but could absorb normal variation. I weight toward "doesn't change" and "decreases" roughly equally, with lower probability on "increases" absent unexpected health news.

factors.description: Weekday→weekend comparison (Tuesday to Sunday) - research shows hospital searches have weekly periodicity with weekday peaks
Flu season past peak and stabilizing per CDC - reduces likelihood of health-driven search spikes
Hospital is a stable evergreen search term with predictable patterns
±3 threshold is narrow (~6%) and may not fully absorb day-of-week variation
Severe flu season (25-year high) could still drive elevated baseline searches
